p: MAB recurrent selection strategies ( Figure 1i) have proven to be useful for the introgression, from exotic germplasm, of simple Mendelian traits, which are those regulated by few genes such as resistance to biotic threats (e.g., [ 73]). However, by definition, MAB may be unable to trace quantitative traits such as heat and drought tolerance that are typically polygenicâ€”regulated by many low-effect genes [ 76]. A last-generation analytical innovation that arose by merging quantitative genetics theory with genomics is predictive breeding, more commonly known as genomic prediction (GP) [ 74, 77, 78].
